DataElement.preferredName: Anti-diarrheal Agent Current Cycle Total Milligram Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the total amount in milligrams of anti-diarrheal medication in the current treatment cycle.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Antidiarrheal Agent Current Therapy Cycle Total Milligram Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pharmacological agent that may ameliorate the symptoms of diarrhetic illnesses._The name of the therapy that is currently being administered._An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Miscellaneous agents found useful in the symptomatic treatment of diarrhea. They have no effect on the agent(s) that cause diarrhea, but merely alleviate the condition. (MeSH)

Concepts.definition: A pharmacological agent that may ameliorate the symptoms of diarrhetic illnesses.

Property.preferredName: Current Therapy Cycle Total Milligram Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: The name of the therapy that is currently being administered.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: The name of the therapy that is currently being administered.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for MHRI GU IRB# 2015-0547: HALT-D protocol, Bowel Movement Endpoint form. 6/6/17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time in milligrams, a metric unit of mass equal to to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms, one milligram equals approximately 0.015432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for MHRI GU IRB# 2015-0547: HALT-D protocol, Bowel Movement Endpoint form. 6/7/17 mc
